PEPFAR Cote d’Ivoire funds the CDC Lab Coalition to provide technical assistance (TA) to strengthen the Ivoirian lab system for HIV/AIDS and other health sectors. FY 2014 funds will support three implementing partners: American Society for Microbiology (ASM), American Society for Clinical Pathology (ASCP), and African Society for Laboratory Medicine (ASLM). CDC lab coalition partners objectives includes: Strengthening laboratory capacity for tuberculosis and sexually transmitted infections diagnostic, development of policies and procedures for implementation of infection control measures within TB/HIV facilities, support to laboratories for quality management systems toward accreditation, and building the clinical-lab interface and to support national strategic goals that will be directly impacted 6 regions. Improving the skills of laboratorians through in-service and pre-service activities and providing technical assistance to the local association of lab technicians. Roll out SLMTA accreditation process in 59 labs using the WHO-AFRO accreditation scheme to measure improvement and uses the SLIPTA program to provide a certificate of recognition. Support a study to identify laboratory workforce gaps that will help review the laboratory workforce standards to inform the development/revision of training programs and policies required to address any workforce gaps identified. These interventions will target laboratories in both rural and urban areas. Sustainability will be ensured by conducting formal monitoring and evaluation on a quarterly basis. Cost-efficiency will be ensured by using essential and local staff to conduct activities. CDC lab coalition partners will ensure that interventions be transitioned to local institution by working closely with the MoH
